name: Aguas do Iguacu Hotel Centro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in July and were pleased with our choice. It was just what we wanted for our short stay in Foz. The location of the hotel is a great bonus - only 5 mins from the bus terminus and not far from decent restaurants. The service was good and the breakfast quite impressive.
reviews.title: A good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent value for money establishment which extends whatever help they can to make your stay an enjoyable one. The rooms are quite large and clean. I have never found the practice of placing clean towels on a bed 'gross' and so cannot complain about that and I noticed that all the beds in the establishment were being replaced when we were there. A good sign that mamagement are continually upgrading their material.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Worth the money

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the region for a few days. It has all you could possibly ask for in a hotel of its size and standard.
reviews.title: Basic hotel, lovely staff

reviews.text: We had an absolute fantastic 3 night stay at Aguas do Iguacu Hotel. This hotel felt more like a 4 star hotel and deserves each star rating (***) bestowed on it. The entrance lobby is neat, modern and spacious with comfortable lounge suites for the guests. The passages are decorated with beautiful photos of overseas locations that give the hotel a real traveller's feeling. The tiled floors are shiny and clean creating a welcoming atmosphere. We had a beautiful, spacious and comfortable double bedroom with en-suite. The full buffet breakfast caters for all with a variety of hot and cold dishes. There are so many dishes to choose from and all the food choices are very tasty. The reception staff members were very friendly, speaking English fluently.The hotel is within walking distance from the central bus terminal (300m) for local or international bus either to the Argentina or Brazilia side of the Iguassu Falls. A variety of fast food stores are located within metres of the front door as well as a pharmacy right next door with an ATM inside. Our room was well worth the rate. We really had a wonderful stay and surely recommend this hotel to anybody travelling to Foz. You will not be disappointed. Come on, book your stay right away at Aguas do Iguacu Hotel!
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: The hotel itself is basic and what you pay for - a decent place to sleep, no major trimmings. The night staff in reception however were brilliant. I never usually have much interaction with hotel staff other than check in/check out, however due to my own stupidity we didn't get stamped into Brazil and had to sort this out before we left for the airport, whilst managing time to visit the Brazil side of the falls as well. They helped us decide how to go about it, got us a cab at mate's rates (the guy showed us the meter and still charged us the cheap price), gave us advice on where to dine (we were going to go with Muffato but apparently the place next to Golden Tulip a few blocks away was better and it was tasty!) and generally made us feel pretty good about staying there. The wi-fi worked, breakfast was vast, even by Argentinian buffet standards, staff spoke English well (do you know how to say "Brother from another Mother" in Portuguese??) The place was generally clean, the coverlet on the bed was a little marked and we decided against using it - note that you don't need to in that climate. The pool outback actually looked usable and there was disabled access which was rare! I would say the safe in the room was totally laughable (coin operated) but it was worth taking a picture of.
reviews.title: Good clean place in Centro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Aguas do Iguacu Hotel in early February 2012 and its location was perfect; just 5min walk to the Bus Station where one can catch a bus for $2-6 to the Brazilian Iguassu National Park and to the Argentinean border. Near the Bus Station there is also a 24hour supermarket so you don’t need to carry your groceries a long way. Nearby the hotel there are several cheap places to eat.
reviews.title: Great value hotel – you will not regret it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was clean, tidy, well decorated, with a nice pool area and friendly reception staff who speak English (this is very important!) The buffet breakfast offered a good variety - fresh fruits, hot stuff, cheeses, cereal etc. We would definitely stay in this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Great hotel, very close to bus terminal (falls & Argentina)

reviews.text: Hotel quite clean and respectable. Staff very friendly, some spoke English other not so much. Booked this hotel mainly due to location. The bus station for buses to the Falls and also for the bus to Argentina (Puerto Iguazu) were about a 5 minute walk. Buffet breakfast is good with fresh fruit and yogurt. There was also a pool which we didn't use. Wifi adequate.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed

reviews.text: The hotel provides a passable accommodation in Foz do Iguacu, with a clean enough/large enough room. However, given the number of choices of hotels in the city, I don't know that we would stay here again. Our room faced a construction site, which started working with loud jackhammers around 8:00 even on the weekends, but that was probably preferable to the other side of the hall which faces a loud street. The advertised free internet in fact cost. The much lauded breakfast was actually a big letdown. While there was a good variety of food, none of it was very good. It was almost like they cooked and baked once a week and just let the food get stale for the rest of the week. The free airport pickup was, however, a definite plus. Overall, there were no main issues, but we don't feel like we got value for the money.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liked the hotel very much. Location is very good. If you are planning to travel by bus around Foz do Iguacu a bus terminal is 3 mins away. There is a tourist office right at the lobby of the hotel. They offer transfers and variety of tours around the city. I have to say very convenient and not pricie. The hotel is clean, breakfast buffet is really good, hotel staff is friendly and helpful. Will definitely chose this hotel next time I am in Foz do Iguacu.
reviews.title: Excellent price and quality performance

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in this hotel when visiting the falls... and it was chilly - about 5 degrees! but the room has ample hot water supply- which is really good and is big !
reviews.title: very very good value for money ! old building but very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only two blocks away from bus terminal, about 4 blocks from a shopping mall, a lot of local restaurants - arabic food easily available....evenings are grand as most people will sit in open air bars with beers - amazing environment
reviews.title: Convenient location, acceptable room

reviews.text: The room was clean and a baby crib was provided for my 1 year old !
reviews.title: Close to bus stop. Clean and good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at the front desk and overall - very very friendly and cheerful and spoke english - very helpful in planning your stay ..
reviews.title: Good service and location but dirty

reviews.text: Another thing i'd like to add is the really good breakfast available - both veg and non veg - many options though the hotel doesnt have a restraunt but food can be ordered and delivered from out ....
reviews.title: Average hotel, great breakfast!!

reviews.text: I really liked the hotel, worth the price. The hotel has amazing staff that help you with everything u need to get around. You have a tour center in the hotel itself that arranges everything fir. Uto get to the fall including transportation. Fox do iguacu is an incredible place to be. You don't need more than two days to se everything. This hotel I recommend , if ur looking for something cheap , simple and clean. Go for it !!!!
reviews.title: Recommend with all my heart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at this hotel. The rooms are simple yet clean. Great value for the price. Complimentary breakfast is really good. The bus stop that takes you to the Iguazu Falls is about 3-4 blocks from the hotel. The hotels that are right on the Park there the falls are were ridiculously expensive. If you're going to visit the Falls, which takes the entire day, you just need a place to crash at night, and this hotel is exactly just for that. The town itself is not a great town to walk around, it felt a little unsafe. We ate dinner at a cheap restaurant in the same block as the hotel which was simple food (sandwiches etc), and it was okay.
reviews.title: Great for visiting Iguacu falls!

reviews.text: My only complaint is that we wanted help with a tour to see the Falls from the Argentinean side, and the concierge was never available. No one in the front desk helped us arrange this. We were lucky enough to find a cab driver who charged us reasonably to drive us to Argentina.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We stayed here back in May last year... just found the photos so I thought I would post them. We thought the hotel was pretty good for the price. It provided all our needs, and the location is excellent, with lots of cafes and restaurants next door (see photos)
reviews.title: Ok Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in January and I had read some good reviews of the hotel online and so I booked it.
reviews.title: ok for 1 night..

aka: Aguas Do Iguacu Hotel Centro Foz Do Iguacu, Brazil
description: Águas do Iguaçu is the most heartlanded hotel in Foz do Iguaçu, with fast and easy access to the Waterfalls, Itaipu Dam, restaurants, local stores, and shopping malls. Parking and Wi-Fi Internet are free of charge.Rooms at the Aguas do Iguacu Hotel Centro is the most spacious and comfortable category have air-conditioning, safe, minibar, cable TV and telephone.Includes in its daily buffet breakfast colonial style with handmade delicacies of the region, cheeses, breads, cakes, fruits, fresh juices and hot and cold items.We are in a hotel car rental company and a travel agency to arrange your rides in Foz do Iguaçu.
